column1: Kafr El Sheikh Governorate is one of the governorates of Egypt. It lies in the northern part of the country
column2: along the western branch of the Nile in the Nile Delta. Its capital is the city of Kafr El Sheikh.

column1: Kafr El Sheikh is the first nationwide in the cultivation of long-staple cotton for export.

column3: was created in 1949. It was originally named Fuadiyah in honor of King Fuad I of Egypt. After the 1952 Revolution and the subsequent abolition of the monarchy
column4: the governorate took the name of its capital city Kafr El Sheikh. This name
column6: means "the village of the chief".The area occupied today by the Kafr El Sheikh Governorate has been inhabited since ancient times and so it has a noteworthy number of archaeological sites
